name: Dear Daisy (Final game)
description:
You awaken in a sort of surgery room, you don’t know where you are or how you got there. You hear a sinister voice say in a radio near you, “YES!!!! YES! I HAVE DONE IT! HAHAHAHA! IT’S ALIVE! OH, IT’S ALIVE, YOU SEE! MMM… YES, YES! RISE MY BEAUTIFUL CREATION, RISE!”

 

Soon you realize that you are this sick Frankenstein creation.

“Can you speak?” says the voice over the loudspeaker.

“Yes” you say.

“Excellent! It looks like everything is working, your core memories are in your hard drive and your training will begin shortly! Are you ready to get to know yourself?”

“Where am I?”

“That will soon be explained! Don’t worry about that now! We MUST get started before Jaime wakes up. Are you ready?”

“I have so many questions -”

“Nevermind that! We MUST-”

You hear a loud crash somewhere in another room.

“Damn! You wait right here I’M WATCHING YOU! Jaime has woken up...”

There is a soft *click* as the radio shuts off.

Now you are left alone in a room with a surgery chair with some surgery tools next to it along with a light right above it.  There is also a counter next to the chair with doctor things on it like jars and a sink, also a flashlight. Under the sink there is a key. The key unlocks the door. When you open the door you hear a sound, almost like a scream, but not quite.

When you step out of the room there is a hallway with many other doors. One of the lights is flickering and all of the doors are locked. There is also a vent on the floor at the end of the hall. This opens and you can crouch into it. It leads to a higher part of the hospital, where you find patient rooms. This is another hallway and you can go in several rooms.
